title: Drawing, "Stage Design: Prison Interior", early 19th century
medium: Pen and black and gray ink, brush and gray, brown and red-brown wash, over black chalk on paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli: Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Design for a stage set.  View of prison cells through enormous vault.  Series of vaulted spaces/hallways.  Small figures, prisoners and guards, at the right hand side of the composition: prisoner in chains, armed guard on watch, and crowd of people approaching with a torch.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Stage Design: Prison Interior", early 19th century.
early 19th century. Pen and black and gray ink, brush and gray, brown and red-brown wash, over black chalk on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-463.
